newsitem.title: UK: W.Cook sees no logic in Triplex Lloyd bid.
newsitem.headline: W.Cook sees no logic in Triplex Lloyd bid.

text.p: British steel firm William Cook Plc said on Friday it could see no convicing industrial logic in a bid formally posted earlier today by engineering group Triplex Lloyd Plc.
Triplex has made a cash and shares offer that effectively values Cook at 58.4 million stg, being worth about 312.9 pence per share at current prices.

In a statement responding to the offer, William Cook said the Triplex bid was "fundamentally flawed", failed to understand the dynamism and quality of the company's business, and cited "synergies and integration opportunities where non exist".
"Triplex Lloyd's bid is financial engineering, wrapped up in spurious industrial logic and selective use of statistics," Andrew Cook, Wiliam Cook chairman said.
"We shall fight this bid with all our energies. Shareholders should continue to take no action".
